greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of 1/(1 - Sum_{k>=1} k!*x^(k*(k+1)/2) / Product_{j=1..k} (1 - x^j)).
comment: Number of ways to choose a strict composition of each part of a composition of n. - _Gus Wiseman_, Jul 18 2020
formula: The Invert transform T(a) of a sequence a is given by T(a)_n = Sum_c Product_i a(c_i), where the sum is over all compositions c of n. - _Gus Wiseman_, Aug 01 2020
example: The a(1) = 1 through a(4) = 14 ways to choose a strict composition of each part of a composition:
mathematica: nmax = 32; CoefficientList[Series[1/(1 - Sum[k! x^(k (k + 1)/2)/Product[(1 - x^j), {j, 1, k}], {k, 1, nmax}]), {x, 0, nmax}], x]
xref: The version for partitions is A270995.
Starting with a strict composition gives A336139.
Strict compositions are counted by A032020.
Partitions of each part of a partition are A063834.
Compositions of each part of a partition are A075900.
Compositions of each part of a composition are A133494.
Strict partitions of each part of a strict partition are A279785.
Compositions of each part of a strict partition are A304961.
Strict partitions of each part of a composition are A304969.
Compositions of each part of a strict composition are A336127.
Set partitions of strict compositions are A336140.
Strict compositions of each part of a partition are A336141.
